alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 10:24PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Montana, including the following county, Big Horn. Portions of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Rain has tapered off, or become very light. Even though rain has tapered off, often times, flooding continues a few hours after the rain stops. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wyola and Crow Indian Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
